      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • nComponents

        int nComponents
        the number of components requested from the calculation, unless larger than the matrix rank in which case the value will be the rank.

      • principalAxes

        double[][] principalAxes
        principal axes a.k.a. principal directions of the data. These are the first nComponents columns of the SVD(X).V matrix. When considering X as sample covariance, Note that SVD(A^T*A).U and V are both == SVD(A).V. the size is [k X k] where k is x[0].length.

      • principalComponents

        double[][] principalComponents
        principal components are the data projected onto the principal axes, formed from the left eigenvectors dot singular values. 
                  principal components = first p columns of U times first p elements of diagonal S:
                               = SVD(X).U * diag(SVD(X).s)
        The size is [n X p] where n is x.length and p is the number of components.

      • fractionVariance

        double fractionVariance
        the fraction of the total variance Q_p (where p is the dimension number, that is, nComponents): 
            Q_p = (SSD_0 − SSD_p)/SSD_0
 
    where SSD_p = summation_{j=p+1 to n}(s_j)
       where s_j is from the diagonal matrix S of the SVD
          of the covariance of x.

      • cumulativeProportion

        double[] cumulativeProportion
        the cumulative addition of (sum_of_eigenvalues - eigenvalue_i)/sum_of_eigenvalues after truncation. that is, the sum of eigenvalues is the sum of the truncated number of eigenvalues, not the entire number from the original decomposition.

      • ssdP

        double ssdP
        Minimum residual variance

      • eigenValues

        double[] eigenValues
        the first nComponents number of eigenValues

      • _s

        double[] _s
        the singular values of SVD(A)

      • uP

        double[][] uP
        the first p eigenvectors of the left eigenvector matrix (which is p columns of U from A = SVD(A).U * SVD(A).D * SVD(A).V^T

    • Constructor Detail

      • PCAStats

        public PCAStats()
